DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text code to identify the anatomic location of the tumor within the brain

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the anatomic position of a tumor within an organ or system or within the patient as a whole.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An abnormal tissue growth resulted from uncontrolled cell proliferation.  Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant ones exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Location; a point or extent in space.

Concepts.definition: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/31/17 jk Transferred context, added RECIST CSI and reg status per Round 5 finalization task. --- revised and updated for ISO compliance; released

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant brain and spinal cord tumor that arises from glial cells (astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, ependymal cells).  Tumors that arise from astrocytes are called astrocytic tumors or astrocytomas.  Tumors that arise from oligodendrocytes are called oligodendroglial tumors.  Tumors that arise from ependymal cells are called ependymomas. -- 2004_Named locations of, or within, the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the brain that is connected to the spinal cord.: The infratentorial compartment of the cranial cavity.  It contains the cerebellum and brain stem.  Its boundaries are formed by the sphenoid bone, temporal bone, and parietal bone.

Concepts.definition: Three sections, the midbrain, pons and medulla oblongata, that are located at the base of the brain. The brain stem regulates the central nervous system, and is vital as a conduit for motor and sensory innervations.
The infratentorial compartment of the cranial cavity. Its boundaries are formed by the sphenoid bone, temporal bone, and parietal bone, and it contains the cerebellum and brain stem.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (sair-uh-BELL-um) The portion of the brain in the back of the head between the cerebrum and the brain stem. The cerebellum controls balance for walking and standing, and other complex motor functions.: The infratentorial compartment of the cranial cavity.  It contains the cerebellum and brain stem.  Its boundaries are formed by the sphenoid bone, temporal bone, and parietal bone.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the brain located at the base of the skull that is responsible for balance, equilibrium and movement.
The infratentorial compartment of the cranial cavity. Its boundaries are formed by the sphenoid bone, temporal bone, and parietal bone, and it contains the cerebellum and brain stem.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not characterized in any other way.: Located in the upper part of the brain.

Concepts.definition: Not characterized in any other way.
Having to do with the upper part of the brain.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Posterior part of the cerebral hemisphere.: Located in the upper part of the brain.

Concepts.definition: One of the four regions of cortex in each cerebral hemisphere. It is located posterior to the temporal lobe and inferior to the parietal lobe.
Having to do with the upper part of the brain.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Upper central part of the cerebral hemisphere.: Located in the upper part of the brain.

Concepts.definition: One of the lobes of the cerebral hemisphere located superiorly to the occipital lobe and posteriorly to the frontal lobe. Cognition and visuospatial processing are its main functions.
Having to do with the upper part of the brain.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lower lateral part of the cerebral hemisphere.: Located in the upper part of the brain.

Concepts.definition: One of the cerebral lobes. It is located inferior to the frontal and parietal lobes and anterior to the occipital lobe.
Having to do with the upper part of the brain.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anterior part of the cerebral hemisphere.: Located in the upper part of the brain.

Concepts.definition: The part of the brain located anterior to the parietal lobes at the front of each cerebral hemisphere.
Having to do with the upper part of the brain.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant brain and spinal cord tumor that arises from glial cells (astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, ependymal cells).  Tumors that arise from astrocytes are called astrocytic tumors or astrocytomas.  Tumors that arise from oligodendrocytes are called oligodendroglial tumors.  Tumors that arise from ependymal cells are called ependymomas. -- 2004:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant brain and spinal cord tumor that arises from glial cells (astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, ependymal cells). Tumors that arise from astrocytes are called astrocytic tumors or astrocytomas. Tumors that arise from oligodendrocytes are called oligodendroglial tumors. Tumors that arise from ependymal cells are called ependymomas.
Named locations of or within the body.
